imageData.altText: Glass jar with oats, stawberries, raspberries, yogurt.

textData.text: Overnight oats are easy to make.
Many people eat oats for breakfast. They are good for our health.
Overnight oats are easy to make. You can soak oats with a liquid and keep it in the fridge overnight. Top with some fruits and nuts in the morning and eat.
There are different types of oats:
are steamed, rolled, and flattened into flakes.
are oat kernels cut into 2 or 3 pieces using a steel blade. These take longer to cook.
have been steamed for longer and rolled much thinner. These cook very fast.
Rolled oats are best for overnight oats because they don’t go mushy.
But they will take longer to soften than quick oats.

htmlData.html: Embed from Getty Images

textData.text: Many people eat oats for breakfast.
They are good for our health.
These recipes are examples to start with.
You can come up with your own ideas too.
• Milks like almond, coconut, or rice milk
The longer the mixture is left, the softer the oats get.
It’s prettier in a glass because you can see the layers.
Blueberry, banana and pecan overnight oats

imageData.altText: Glas jar with blueberry, banana, pecan overnight oats with honey.

textData.text: Mix everything together and leave in the fridge till the next morning.
Almond or rice milk, Vanilla extract, Ground cinnamon, Pinch of ground cloves
Layer with yogurt and some almonds.
Drizzle honey on top and refrigerate overnight.

imageData.altText: Glass jar with oats, yogurt, chopped almond. Honey being drizzeld on top layer.

textData.text: • ½ cup almond or rice milk
Quick tips for making overnight oats:

Use the right amount of liquid. Usually, the liquid is milk. If you use too much liquid, it will become soup. If you use too little liquid, the oats wont become soft. So, just remember to use double the quantity of liquid. If you are using 1 cup oats, add 2 cups milk.
Always top up with fruits and nuts in the morning. Do not soak them overnight.
Stir in milk. Layer yogurt and some strawberries.
Sprinkle chia seeds if you have them.
Put some raspberries in the freezer overnight.
Take overnight oats out of the fridge in the morning.

imageData.altText: Glass jar with oats, stawberries, raspberries, yogurt.

textData.text: Add oats to a bowl or glass jar. Pour in milk. Mix in vanilla extract and cinnamon. Add chia seeds if you have them.
Now add a layer of peanut butter and then a layer of sliced banana. Continue this way until the jar is full. Drizzle with honey. Let it sleep in the fridge.

imageData.altText: Glass jar filled with oats, banana, peanut butter

textData.text: Stir in coconut milk. Any other milk will do, too.
Drizzle honey on top and refrigerate overnight.
If using crushed graham crackers, add just before serving.

imageData.altText: Glass jar with Kiwi lime pie overnight oats

textData.text: • 1 tablespoon chopped almonds or crushed graham crackers
